descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar focuses broadly on the organizational forms that constitute the international political environment. While the course discusses international organizations (IOs) such as the United Nations, World Trade Organization, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, NATO, and World Health Organization, it is not strictly about IOs. The purpose of the course is to engage classic and frontier research that analyzes the organization of global politics and explores the variation in organizational forms in the international realm across time and space.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The narrow purpose of the course is to prepare graduate students for their comprehensive exams in the field of International Relations; the broader goal is to assay the development and direction of the research area.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Discussion participation (35%); critical response paper (15%); research paper or take-home examination (50%)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: All readings will be available electronically via the course canvas page

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Attendance at first class is required. Readings for the first meeting will be posted on the course website
